page.title: 16HOUSING.HISTORICAL INTEREST
page.content: {Oak Cottage} Blakes Lane, Hare Hatch is recorded to have been in existence in 1550. {Bear Ash,} Hare Hatch, which was originally a Keeper's Cottage, was started in the 16th Century and has been added to over the years. {Chantry Cottage,}Waltham St. Lawrence was built around 1560. It was probably a tithe cottage to a farm. It is a Grade II listed property. {La Chaumiere,}Hare Hatch, is 400 years old with an 8yr. old extension. {Littlewick Place,}Littlewick Green, is part Elizabethan, part Georgian and part Modern. The original was a small timber framed house on the edge of {Windsor Forest}and was probably used as a Hunting lodge. {Keeper's Cottage,}Scarletts Wood, has belonged to the Barker family since 1800. It was a gamekeeper's cottage.
